summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, setting a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, and establishing a detailed schedule for jury selection, motions, and pretrial conferences leading up to the trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order sets the trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order setting the trial date and related schedules.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell, as evidenced by this scheduling order.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Commencement
events.description: The jury trial in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to commence.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for an in-person pretrial conference.

events.title: Court Sets Initial Schedule
events.description: The Court set an initial schedule for the case, which is referenced and amended by this order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A firm trial date for Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case was set for November 29, 2021.
The order establishes a detailed pre-trial schedule including juror questionnaire administration (Nov 4, 5, 12), voir dire (Nov 16-19), and deadlines for motions and proposed jury instructions.
The proceedings are subject to COVID-19 protocols affecting courtroom space and public access.
The order is issued by United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
